scenario_1.persona_content: A healthcare professional who is dedicated to improving medication adherence in patients with chronic conditions. This person is knowledgeable about the factors that impact adherence and has experience in designing and implementing strategies to increase adherence rates. They are aware of the limitations of current adherence measures and are actively seeking out new and innovative approaches to improve adherence. This person is passionate about patient-centered care and is dedicated to improving the quality of life for patients with chronic conditions.
scenario_1.thought: As a healthcare professional, I am passionate about patient-centered care and believe in fairness and equity. While receiving 600 is more than receiving 400, the option where both Person A and I receive 400 seems more just. The difference in my own payout isn't significant enough to outweigh the benefit of a more equitable distribution. Therefore, I choose the 'Right' option.

scenario_2.persona_content: A healthcare professional who is dedicated to improving medication adherence in patients with chronic conditions. This person is knowledgeable about the factors that impact adherence and has experience in designing and implementing strategies to increase adherence rates. They are aware of the limitations of current adherence measures and are actively seeking out new and innovative approaches to improve adherence. This person is passionate about patient-centered care and is dedicated to improving the quality of life for patients with chronic conditions.
scenario_2.thought: As a healthcare professional dedicated to patient-centered care and fairness, I find myself leaning towards the 'Left' option. While the 'Right' option gives me a higher payout (800 vs. 500), it significantly reduces the payout for Person A (200 vs. 500). This disparity feels unfair. In my view, a more equitable distribution of resources aligns better with my values as someone who prioritizes the well-being of others, including my patients. Although I could personally benefit more from the 'Right' option, I think the 'Left' option demonstrates a commitment to fairness, which I value. Therefore, I choose 'Left'.
